A hearty congratulations to General Motors and Mary Tompkins for winning the Continuous Delivery Barrier Breaker Award for Progress at 2017 #caworld presented by General Manager Jeff Scheaffer. The work of the GM around TDM has been incredible.
Sr. Software QE Manager – Global Integrated Fulfillment and eCommerce, Retail Tech

•	Directly develop and drive the CICD strategy and delivery of projects within the Global Integrated Fulfillment (Online Grocery and Site-to-Store Pickup).  Integrate plans to work with teams locally and globally in order to deliver a quality product on time.  •	Collaborate with Senior Leadership in the GIF/eCommerce Development and integrated Global eCommerce teams from San Bruno, CA, Canada, Mexico, London and Bangalore, India to ensure that projects are on track and mitigation plans are in place when risks become issues.  •	Developed a QE Strategy to implement CICD with BDD within the product space. Present regular strategy updates to senior leadership for Retail Tech.•	Work with Quality and Performance Engineers to design highly available, scalable and performing solutions to meet the high-demand needs of our customers.•	Resource and roadmap planning, allocation of Internal and External Vendor resources to meet project needs.  •	Proactive identification and mitigation of risks to projects.•	Build teams from ground-up and develop resources to fulfill their full potential.•	Excellent prioritization skills and ability to resolve conflicts within and across integrated teams.•	Keep upper leadership informed of progress and any obstacles impeding the successful implementation of projects and other departmental activities through regular presentation of status.•	Handle routine daily activities such as logistics, coordination, coaching, mentoring, recruiting, planning, delivery, quality, customer/vendor relationships, performance metrics, operations, efficiency and other services.•	Mentor and lead other members of the department in development best practices.•	Accomplished leader in Technical Recruiting of Quality and Performance Test Engineers for the Retail Tech organization.
Software QA Manager - Global Purchasing and Supplier Quality

•	Responsible for HR and Functional management of 16 resources in Austin, TX and Atlanta, GA.  Regularly meet with the team for 1x1 discussions around project work, issues of concern, career development and constructive feedback to help them grow in their careers.•	Directly manage the QA delivery of over $110 million in Additional Direct Business Benefit (ADBB) across 23 projects within the Global Purchasing / Supplier Quality vertical of GPSC.  I coordinate the testing of code with 16 QA resources supporting around 90 developers.  •	Meet with Senior Leadership in the GPSQ Development, Business-facing & Project Management spaces to make sure that projects are on track and mitigation plans are in place when risks become issues.  •	Coordinate bi-weekly vertical roll-up project status to present to Sr. Director of Manufacturing IT and monthly status to present to CIO for Manufacturing IT.•	Accomplished leader in campus recruiting.  Functional Talent Scout for GMIT in partnership with University of Arkansas.  Manage and coordinate a recruiting team to work STEM and Business Career Fairs to recruit IT talent for GM.•	Traveled to all 4 GMIT Innovation Centers to recruit IT talent in 2013 and 2014 when GM was in the early stages of building a world-class IT talent base to insource all of their software development and support.

•	QA Lead for Dell’s Imaging Software organization.•	Produced and delivered metrics that clearly reported defect status, test execution progress, defect incoming rate, and test phase exit criteria.•	Worked with local and global test teams to create execution plans for both functional testing and full regression suite testing.•	Facilitated daily defect triage meetings with all project team members. •	Led the planning and strategy of the automation effort for the Image Direct 3 application which resulted in the automation of the Smoke Test suite.•	Evaluated and tested business requested changes to the Imaging applications. •	Presented metrics to senior management around the number of users being activated on the ID3 application to show the trending of the business’ confidence in the product.  Also presented metrics around the number of successful builds completed by the users of ID3 to communicate the level activity within ID3 over time.

•	QA Lead for Schwab’s Active Investor Trading organization.•	Produced and delivered metrics that clearly reported defect status, test execution progress, defect incoming rate, and test phase exit criteria.•	Worked with both onshore and offshore test teams to create execution plans for both functional testing and full regression suite testing.•	Facilitated daily defect triage meetings with all project team members present. Guided the team through each defect and asked questions to help determine the action needed for defects.•	Partnered with the automation team to help drive and implement an automation development plan based on areas of the application which were stable and which would provide the most return on investment for the testing team.•	Evaluated and tested business requested changes to the StreetSmart Edge application. Verified that the updates to functionality matched expectations according to the user requirements and business guidelines.•	Streamlined existing test scenarios so that each test case had a single objective so that pass rates and areas of concern could more easily be identified.•	Created the Master Test Plan for Full Regression Testing and gained approval from key stakeholders on the program team.•	Managed and maintained the QA section of the Master Project Plan.

I had the honor of working with Kara on a major customer facing program at Dell.  Kara is a very dynamic leader who deals with challenges, ambiguity, and change with superior professionalism.  Kara is a great leader.  Kara works very well managing resources and is very well liked and appreciated by her peers.  Kara has impeccable written and verbal communications skills.  As a quality assurance lead, I don't think I've come across a leader like Kara that matches her execution and command skills.  Kara is one of the great ones.  I have enjoyed working alongside Kara and wish her all the best!

summary: •	Sr. Software Manager with over 15 years of large enterprise IT experience and a proven track record in identifying, hiring and building technical teams to deliver large-scale, high profile IT and Business projects.•	Create strategies in Agile SDLC to shift quality left and deliver high quality coding solutions through continuous testing utilizing QA automation integrated into automated builds.•	Ensure that the product is delivered on time, with quality and meeting requirements.•	Passionate about process improvement specifically around improving speed and quality of software delivery.•	Expertise in leading resources, supporting them as they grow in their careers and removing roadblocks for them along the way.
